headline: Exxon, Chevron turn page on legal fight as profits slip
summary:
Lower crude prices dented profits at ExxonMobil and Chevron as the companies signaled Friday they are moving past a legal fight over an acquisition ultimately won by the latter firm.- Closing the gap -
But Chevron CEO Mike Wirth said the company expects to end 2025 close to four million barrels per day following the completion of its $53 billion acquisition of US company Hess, which was delayed for more than a year following a legal spat with ExxonMobil.

raw.headline: Exxon, Chevron turn page on legal fight as profits slip
raw.summary:
Lower crude prices dented profits at ExxonMobil and Chevron as the companies signaled Friday they are moving past a legal fight over an acquisition ultimately won by the latter firm.- Closing the gap -
But Chevron CEO Mike Wirth said the company expects to end 2025 close to four million barrels per day following the completion of its $53 billion acquisition of US company Hess, which was delayed for more than a year following a legal spat with ExxonMobil.

headline: Exxon, Chevron top Q2 estimates: Key takeaways
summary: Exxon (XOM) and Chevron (CVX) reported second quarter profits at four-year lows but still topped estimates as oil (CL=F, BZ=F) production climbed. Fernando Valle, Hedgeye Risk Management Energy Analyst, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Ines Ferré discuss how M&A and shale dominance could drive future growth despite soft prices. headline: Exxon Stock Slips After Earnings. The CEO Might Have Spooked Investors.
summary: Exxon Mobil  stock slipped on Friday, despite the company’s better-than-expected second-quarter earnings and production numbers.  It might have been something that CEO Darren Woods said.  In response to an analyst question on the earnings call, Woods said Exxon is looking at buying other companies.

headline: Trump tariffs spark 'deep concern' among Brazil chemical firms
summary: SAO PAULO (Reuters) -An association representing chemical companies in Brazil, where large U.S. firms like ExxonMobil and Dow Chemical operate, expressed "deep concern" regarding a U.S. executive order raising tariffs on Brazilian exports to 50%.  The Brazilian chemical sector is intrinsically tied with the United States, Abiquim said in a statement on Friday, describing a relationship marked by "integration" and "cross-investments."

raw.headline: Trump tariffs spark 'deep concern' among Brazil chemical firms
raw.summary: SAO PAULO (Reuters) -An association representing chemical companies in Brazil, where large U.S. firms like ExxonMobil and Dow Chemical operate, expressed "deep concern" regarding a U.S. executive order raising tariffs on Brazilian exports to 50%.  The Brazilian chemical sector is intrinsically tied with the United States, Abiquim said in a statement on Friday, describing a relationship marked by "integration" and "cross-investments."

headline: Exxon Mobil Hits Record Production, CEO Reaffirms Hunt For Value-Driven Deals
summary: Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE:XOM) announced on Friday its second-quarter 2025 earnings of $7.1 billion, or $1.64 per share, exceeding analyst estimates of $1.47. The company’s total revenues of $81.51 billion also surpassed the consensus forecast of $79.34 billion. Operational performance was a key highlight, with the company achieving its highest second-quarter Upstream production since the Exxon-Mobil merger more than 25 years ago. Total production reached 4.6 million oil-equivalent barrels p

headline: Coinbase, ExxonMobil & Chevron, Moderna: Trending Tickers
summary: Coinbase (COIN) shares are under pressure after a drop in adjusted profit, with sluggish retail crypto trading volumes despite rising crypto prices. ExxonMobil (XOM) and Chevron (CVX) reported steep profit declines in the second quarter, though both topped revenue expectations as oil production hit record levels. Moderna (MRNA) reported a smaller loss than expected in Q2 but lowered the high-end of its full-year revenue outlook amid shipment delays to the UK. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Exxon Stock Is Rising on Earnings. Upstream Production Is the Highest in Years.
summary: Exxon Mobil  stock got a lift in premarket trading Friday after the oil giant posted earnings and revenue that beat expectations.  Second-quarter earnings of $1.64 a share topped the $1.57 analysts had anticipated, according to FactSet.  Revenue of $81.5 billion also beat the $80.7 billion consensus estimate.

headline: Fourth Annual National Truck Driver Appreciation Sweepstakes Underway
summary: Trucker Path, the most comprehensive and relied-upon mobile app for North American truckers, today announced the fourth annual National Truck Driver Appreciation Sweepstakes (NTDAS). U.S. truck drivers with a valid commercial driver's license can enter the sweepstakes from August 4 to September 12, 2025.

headline: Q2 profits at Exxon Mobil and Chevron dip to lowest level in 4 years on subdued energy prices
summary: Exxon Mobil’s second-quarter profit dropped to the lowest level in four years and sales fell as oil prices slumped as OPEC+ ramped up production.  Exxon earned $7.08 billion, or $1.64 per share, for the period ended June 30.  A year earlier it earned $9.24 billion, or $2.14 per share.
